intro: Saxofridericia compressa, commonly known as the compressed saxofridericia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
